        public static boolean isNull(Object obj)
        Determines if the given Object is null or not. 
            Gen.isNull(null)     = true
    Gen.isNull("")       = false
    Gen.isNull(456)      = false
    Gen.isNull("foobar") = false

        public static boolean isEmpty(Object obj)
        Gen.isEmpty(null) = true Gen.isEmpty("") = true Gen.isEmpty(new StringBuilder(n)) = true Gen.isEmpty(new ArrayList(n)) = true Gen.isEmpty("foo fighters!") = false Gen.isEmpty(list of items) = false

      • length

        public static int length(Object obj)
        Find the length/size of the given object. Gen.getLength(null) = 0 Gen.getLength("") = 0 Gen.getLength("a") = 1 Gen.getLength("xyz") = 3

      • numElements

        public static int numElements(Object array)
        Find the number of elements in an array or list. Gen.numElements(null) = 0 Gen.numElements(int[]) = 0 Gen.numElements(byte[]{0x45}) = 1 Gen.numElements(byte[]{0x67, 0x22, 0xEC}) = 3

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(long msec)
        Sleep for msec duration but do not throw an exception. Gen.sleep(2) Gen.sleep(50) Gen.sleep(1000)

      • getItem

        public static Object getItem(Object[] objs,
                             int index,
                             Object def)
        Safely retrieve an item from an array of objects. If the index is out of range, or the object is null, then simply return the passed-in default value. final Object[] items = {"hey", 1, false}; Gen.getItem(null, 0, null) = null Gen.getItem(null, 0, "foo") = "foo" Gen.getItem(items, 0, null) = "zero" Gen.getItem(items, 1, null) = 1 Gen.getItem(items, 2, null) = false Gen.getItem(items, 3, null) = null

      • getArg

        public static String getArg(String[] args,
                            int index)
        Safely retrieve an item from an array of strings. If the argument is null or the index is out of range, then an empty string is returned. final String[] args = {"zero", "one", "two"}; Gen.getArg(null, 0) = "" Gen.getArg(args, -1) = "" Gen.getArg(args, 0) = "zero" Gen.getArg(args, 1) = "one" Gen.getArg(args, 2) = "two" Gen.getArg(args, 3) = ""

      • getField

        public static String getField(String input,
                              int num)
        Safely retrieve a field from inside a string. Fields are separated by one or more spaces; multiple spaces between items is acceptable. If the argument is null or the index is out of range, then an empty string is returned. Indexes are numbered starting at one. Gen.getField(null, 0) = "" Gen.getField("one two three", -1) = "" Gen.getField("one two three", 0) = "" Gen.getField("one two three", 1) = "one" Gen.getField("one two three", 2) = "two" Gen.getField("one two three", 3) = "three" Gen.getField("one two three", 4) = "" Gen.getField(" one two three ", 2) = "two"
        Parameters:
        num - num >= 1

      • getField

        public static String getField(String input,
                              int num,
                              String separator)
        Safely retrieve a field from inside a string. Fields are separated by one or more of "separators"; multiple separators between items is acceptable. If the argument is null or the index is out of range, then an empty string is returned. Indexes are numbered starting at one. Gen.getField(null, 0) = "" Gen.getField("one;two;three", -1, ";") = "" Gen.getField("one;two;three", 0, ";") = "" Gen.getField("one-two-three", 1, "-") = "one" Gen.getField("one:two:three", 2, ":") = "two" Gen.getField("one#two#three", 3, "#") = "three" Gen.getField("one#two#three", 4, "#") = "" Gen.getField("one##three", 3, "#") = "three"

      • getCurrentMethodName

        public static String getCurrentMethodName()
        Call this method in this manner: Gen.getCurrentMethodName() See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/442747/getting-the-name-of-the-currently-executing-method
        Returns:
        name of the currently executing method, used for debugging purposes

      • getCurrentMethodNameLambda

        public static String getCurrentMethodNameLambda()
        This method MUST be called using a lambda, otherwise it will return an incorrect method name: log.trace("{}", Gen::getCurrentMethodNameLambda);
        Returns:
        name of the currently executing method, used for debugging purposes
